info.label: Technical Engineering Leader
info.brief: A passionate Engineering Leader with an established record of guiding teams of SREs, Operators, Software Engineers, and Database Professionals to new peaks in quality, performance, efficiency, and personal satisfaction. Draws upon an extensive background as an innovative and multi-disciplinary DevOps Engineer, providing strong technical direction with a focus on mentorship, process optimization, and strategic target identification to maximize team results and eliminate unnecessary toil.

employment.summary: Additional work history available upon request.

history.summary: Responsible for the development and delivery of container and hypervisor compute platforms supporting the Virtustream Storage Cloud and Next-Generation Virtustream Enterprise Cloud (IaaS) as well as all major supporting datacenter services.
highlights: Retained prior responsibilities for the Virtustream Storage Cloud container platform while adding operations support for a public Openstack IaaS product and the operations and maintenance of all core services in Openstack datacenters such as log collection, monitoring, dns, auth, smtp, ntp, and others.
Recognized as a change agent in the field of operational efficiency and stable service delivery demonstrating a peak team operating efficiency of 3400 services per head with a 15% toil rate.
Drove the design, development, and implementation of the next-generation IaaS platform with significant benefits to operational overhead, durability, availability, scalability, and service delivery.

Entrusted with the operation of core services in the Next-Generation IaaS platform with a fully containerized stack including such major functions as auth, identity, mail, alerting, monitoring, logging, ntp, dns, certificates-as-a-service, key-value stores, message buses, secret stores, and others.
Orchestrated the development and adoption of the next-generation container platform based on Kubernetes and Helm within the next-generation IaaS platform and the next-generation storage cloud.
Developed automated tooling for security compliance and audit evidence collection, reducing compliance-related toil by 85%.

history.summary: Responsible for leading the continued advancement and operations of the container platform supporting the Virtustream Storage Cloud.
highlights: Continued leadership of the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team responsible for the operations of the container platform supporting the Virtustream Storage Cloud.
Evangelized the use of automation through presentations and training within the broader organization and beyond.
Developed automation and state systems for performing zero-dropped-connection rolling updates of the container platform.
Drove constant improvements in monitoring, testing, reliability, durability, adoption, and usability of the container platform and services running atop it.
Maintained team morale, focus, productivity, and platform SLAs through a 50% workforce reduction instituted under new leadership.
Set the strategy for the next generation (Kubernetes) container platform and rallied team members under the new initiative.

history.summary: Responsible for the availability, latency, performance, efficiency, change management, monitoring, emergency response and capacity planning of infrastructure services and platforms.
highlights: Lead a team of Site Reliability Engineers (SRE) responsible for the development and operations of a customized implementation of Apache Mesos for a multi-exabyte, distributed public storage cloud.

Architect and core contributor of a stateful automation suite capable of bootstrapping and maintaining a PCI-compliant container platform on physical infrastructure in all global datacenters with no human interaction and a ten-minute execution window.
Orchestrated the container platform build architecture, operations model, and user adoption strategy that resulted in a 300% increase in year over year platform adoption.
Developed a new paradigm for reusable, testable automation with Salt and LXC that reduced test execution times by 90%.
Composed stateful automation modules in Python and provided a Python / development mentorship function for SREs.
Implemented monitoring and service health check tooling to guarantee SLO target achievement.
Participated in on-call incident management and toil-elimination activities.

history.summary: Responsible for the development and instruction of the Software Application Programming curriculum for the newly established Bachelor Degree in Information Systems.
highlights: Created a modern application development curriculum using entirely Free and Open Source Software (FOSS).

Developed a continuous integration toolchain to provide automated assignment scoring via unit tests, integration tests, and linters in Docker sandboxes with near-instantaneous feedback given to students.

Fostered a culture of readability, performance, and precision that prepared students for real world, multi-engineer environments where 99.9% is the lowest bar for success and is exceeded though iteration and adherence to idiomatic design.

history.summary: Responsible for application services administration and the development of internal software solutions.
highlights: Oversaw a net 600% increase of the staff to supported service ratio of the Information Technology, largely due to automation and standardization efforts.
Created and administered a DevOps Mentorship program to modernize and expand the skills of IT Staff.
Implemented The School's first CI/CD pipeline using Jenkins, Git, and Salt and expanded its use to all projects within a year of initial implementation.
Spearheaded the use of stateful automation tooling throughout all service lines and pioneered the use of immutable (containerized) infrastructure.

Partnered with the NYC Office of Emergency Management and the Open Source Community to transform business needs into Sahana Agasti, an Open-Source Emergency Management solution that utilized geographic data to deploy staff and track shelter operations during Hurricanes Irene and Sandy.

history.summary: Responsible for the design, development, and administration of all data systems.
highlights: Lead the efforts of full-stack engineers building dynamic web applications.
Oversaw the construction of The School's first independent datacenter.
Developed the NYC Coastal Storm Plan Training System in partnership with the NYC Office of Emergency Management.
Designed and implemented a plan to migrate a portion of The School's website to a CMS, reducing administrator toil by 95%.

history.summary: Supervisded data warehousing, reporting, and cleanup activities for grant-funded research initiatives.
Managed data reporting activities for the CUNY Office of Academic Affairs.
Developed original site's content, images, styles and infrastructure for the Theatre and Dance Department website.

history.title: Bachelor of Fine Arts
history.summary: Graduated from Millikin University (Decatur, IL) in 2003 with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Musical Theatre.

governance.summary: Lead the Agasti project on the Sahana Project Management Committee, a project focused on disaster preparedness and shelter operations used in New York City during Hurricanes Irene and Sandy.

reading.title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
reading.author: Robert C. Martin
reading.summary: One of the better abstract approaches to software design and one of the first tools I regularly offer to developers in need of guidance.

reading.title: First, Break All The Rules: What the World's Greatest Managers Do Differently
reading.author: Marcus Buckingham
reading.summary: A thought-provoking set of case studies on the role of a manager and managerial action.

reading.title: Turn the Ship Around!: A True Story of Turning Followers into Leaders
reading.author: L. David Marquet
reading.summary: An exploration of the manager's role in fostering self-governance and building a culture of functional leaders.

reading.title: Site Reliability Engineering: How Google Runs Production Systems
reading.author: Betsy Beyer, Chris Jones, Jennifer Petoff
reading.summary: The go-to resource for implementing an SRE approach to stable, agile service delivery.

reading.title: The Site Reliability Workbook: Practical Ways to Implement SRE
reading.author: Betsy Beyer
reading.summary: An excellent supplement to the original SRE book that provides necessary practical examples for implementing the SRE approach to service delivery.

speaking.title: How the Challenge of Deploying Mesos Revolutionized the Way We Use SaltStack
Sahana Agasti: Mayon for HyperScale Emergency Management

recognition.title: Excellence in Technology Service
recognition.summary: Awarded for Excellence in Technology Service related to classroom innovations in software development and instruction.

recognition.title: Michael Ribaudo Award for Computing Achievement
recognition.summary: Awarded for contributions to the New York City response to Hurricaine Irene via the Sahana Disaster Management Software Project.

interests.name: 3D Modeling and Digital Fabrication
interests.summary: Practices 3d modeling and digital fabrication with experience in 3D printing, laser cutting, and CNC.

interests.name: Propmaking
interests.summary: Combines digital fabrication techniques with traditional techniques such as casting, molding, and wearable electronics in the creation of prop replicas.

interests.name: Leatherworking
interests.summary: Works leather in the construction and detailing of garments and cases.

interests.name: Hobbyist Board Games
interests.summary: Enjoys games focused on strategy, team building, and resource constraint simulation.
